w:r.w:t: LO1: Students will be able to set up a Dell Latitude 5440 laptop, including creating a Microsoft account and installing essential software.
LO2: Students will understand the different features of the Latitude 5440, such as ports and connectivity options.
PA1: Students will demonstrate effective problem-solving skills when encountering technical issues during setup.
PA2: Students will exhibit strong communication skills when asking questions and collaborating with peers on the setup process.

Start by engaging the students in a discussion about their previous experiences with setting up computers. Ask questions like, 'Have you ever set up a laptop before? What challenges did you face during that process?' Encourage them to share their stories and make mental notes of any misconceptions they may have.
Provide an overview of the Latitude 5440 laptop, highlighting its key features such as ports, connectivity options, and screen size. Show images or videos to illustrate these features.

Demonstrate the step-by-step process of setting up the Latitude 5440. This includes connecting to a secured wireless network, creating a Microsoft account, and installing essential software like Dell Help & Support and SupportAssist.

Divide the class into groups of three. Provide each group with a Latitude 5440 laptop and guide them through the same setup process demonstrated earlier. Encourage students to ask questions and work collaboratively.
Ask each group to present their setup process to the class. Encourage students to explain any challenges they faced and how they overcame them.

As students present, provide constructive feedback on their problem-solving skills, communication, and collaboration. Highlight any misconceptions and correct them for the benefit of the entire class.

Administer a quiz to assess students' understanding of the Latitude 5440 features and their ability to perform essential tasks like connecting to a network and installing software. Include questions on troubleshooting common issues encountered during setup.

Provide individualized feedback on the quiz results, addressing any areas of improvement and celebrating successes. Encourage students to continue practicing their problem-solving skills and effective communication in future endeavors.

Have students create a brief tutorial on how to set up the Latitude 5440, detailing each step and any potential issues they encountered. This can be in the form of a written guide, video, or presentation.

Share these tutorials among the class, allowing students to learn from one another's experiences. Discuss any similarities and differences in approach and encourage further reflection on best practices for troubleshooting and collaboration.
